title: SEE 2081 English Practice Test 5
subject: english
instructionsEnglish: Candidates are required to answer the questions in their own words as far as practicable. Figures in the margin indicate the full marks. Attempt all the questions.

questions.title: Read the poem and do the tasks.

passage.title: Composed upon Westminster Bridge, September 3, 1802
passage.author: William Wordsworth
passage.content:
Earth has not anything to show more fair:
Dull would he be of soul who could pass by
A sight so touching in its majesty:
This City now doth, like a garment, wear
The beauty of the morning; silent, bare,
Ships, towers, domes, theatres, and temples lie
Open unto the fields, and to the sky;
All bright and glittering in the smokeless air.
Never did sun more beautifully steep
In his first splendour, valley, rock, or hill;
Ne'er saw I, never felt, a calm so deep!
The river glideth at his own sweet will:
Dear God! the very houses seem asleep;
And all that mighty heart is lying still!

subSections.title: Read and complete the sentences below with the correct information from the poem.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The speaker shares his impressions of the view from __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Westminster Bridge
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताको शीर्षक 'Composed upon Westminster Bridge' हो, जसले वक्ताको स्थानलाई स्पष्ट पार्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The title of the poem is 'Composed upon Westminster Bridge,' which indicates the speaker's location. 
Citation: Lesson 12.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: He, who does not praise the beauty of nature is __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: dull of soul
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताले भन्छ, "Dull would he be of soul who could pass by / A sight so touching in its majesty."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The poem states, "Dull would he be of soul who could pass by / A sight so touching in its majesty." 
Citation: Lesson 12.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Temples, towers, domes, etc. are shining in __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: the smokeless air
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताले वर्णन गर्दछ, "All bright and glittering in the smokeless air."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The poem describes them as "All bright and glittering in the smokeless air." 
Citation: Lesson 12.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The poet feels __________ to see the outlines of the city buildings.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: a calm so deep
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविले भन्छन्, "Ne'er saw I, never felt, a calm so deep!"
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The poet says, "Ne'er saw I, never felt, a calm so deep!" 
Citation: Lesson 12.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The houses are asleep and the heart of London is __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: lying still
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताको अन्तिम पङ्क्ति हो, "And all that mighty heart is lying still!"
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The last line of the poem is, "And all that mighty heart is lying still!" 
Citation: Lesson 12.

questions.title: Read the text and do the tasks.

passage.title: Bird Migration
passage.content:
Like marathon runners, birds pace themselves so they do not run out of energy before they can land. They are always adjusting speed, height and flight path to account for changing winds, their own weight, and storms. In the spring, they retrace their paths back to their summer homes. Each fall, about five billion birds migrate south for the winter from North America. Nearly all 500 of the 650 species of North American birds migrate. Yet this is just one small part of the picture. More than half of all the bird species in the world-approximately 5,000 species- migrate, and each species is on a different journey.

Other animal species also migrate, including insects, amphibians, reptiles, fish and mammals. Migration is happening all the time: Herds of wild beast arrive every January at green pastures in the Southern Serengeti of Africa. Swarms of free tailed bats arrive each March to caves in Texas. Northern fur seals gather on Alaskan islands each June. In September, Chinook salmon swim up rivers in Washington State. If you are in the right place at the right time, you can witness these amazing journeys. Yet, no matter where you live, you can see some birds migrating. In fact, much of what we know about migration comes from studying birds.

subSections.title: Write ‘TRUE’ for true and ‘FALSE’ for the false statements.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Birds store energy for their flights by running like marathon runners.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले चराहरूलाई म्याराथन धावकहरूसँग तुलना गर्छ (pace themselves), तर तिनीहरू धावकजस्तै दौडेर शक्ति सञ्चय गर्छन् भन्दैन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The text compares birds to marathon runners in how they pace themselves, not that they run to store energy. 
Citation: Lesson 13.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Almost five million birds migrate south from North America in winter season.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा "about five billion birds" भनिएको छ, पाँच मिलियन होइन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The text says "about five billion birds," not five million. 
Citation: Lesson 13.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Migration is a regular process among animal species.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: TRUE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले भन्छ, "Migration is happening all the time" र धेरै प्रजातिहरू बसाइँ सर्छन्।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The text states, "Migration is happening all the time," and lists various species that migrate. 
Citation: Lesson 13.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Swarms of free tailed bats migrate to caves in Texas every March.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: TRUE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा उल्लेख छ, "Swarms of free tailed bats arrive each March to caves in Texas."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The text mentions, "Swarms of free tailed bats arrive each March to caves in Texas." 
Citation: Lesson 13.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: We can observe bird migration only from Washington State.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले भन्छ, "no matter where you live, you can see some birds migrating."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The text says, "no matter where you live, you can see some birds migrating." 
Citation: Lesson 13.

subSections.title: Answer the following questions in full sentences.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What are the birds compared with in the text?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The birds are compared with marathon runners.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठको पहिलो वाक्यमा भनिएको छ, "Like marathon runners, birds pace themselves..."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The first sentence of the text states, "Like marathon runners, birds pace themselves..." 
Citation: Lesson 13.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: When do the birds return to their summer homes?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: They return to their summer homes in the spring.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा उल्लेख छ, "In the spring, they retrace their paths back to their summer homes."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The text mentions, "In the spring, they retrace their paths back to their summer homes." 
Citation: Lesson 13.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What portion of all the bird species move from one place to another?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: More than half of all the bird species in the world migrate.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले भन्छ, "More than half of all the bird species in the world... migrate."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The text states, "More than half of all the bird species in the world... migrate." 
Citation: Lesson 13.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Which animal species except birds migrate?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Insects, amphibians, reptiles, fish, and mammals also migrate.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले "including insects, amphibians, reptiles, fish and mammals" लाई बसाइँ सर्ने प्रजातिको रूपमा सूचीबद्ध गर्दछ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The text lists "insects, amphibians, reptiles, fish and mammals" as species that also migrate. 
Citation: Lesson 13.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Why do you think the wild beasts migrate to the green pastures in Africa? Give a reason.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: They likely migrate to find food, as green pastures provide grazing.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: हरियो खर्क (green pastures) ले खाना (घाँस) उपलब्ध गराउने भएकोले उनीहरू त्यहाँ जान्छन्।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
Green pastures provide food (grazing), which is the likely reason for their migration. 
Citation: Lesson 13.

questions.title: Read the following text and do the tasks.

passage.title: Janakpur Bolts Thump Sudurpaschim to Clinch Inaugural Nepal Premier League Title
passage.content:
By MyKhel Staff, December 21
Janakpur Bolts clinched the first ever Nepal Premier League after a thumping 5-wicket win over Sudurpaschim Royals in the final at the TU International Stadium in Kirtipur on Saturday. Lahiru Milantha smashed a 49-ball 87 as Janakpur Bolts made light work of the run chase of 185 against Sudurpaschim Royals. Milantha and skipper Aasif Sheikh (33 off 19 balls) shared a 73-run stand for the first wicket in seven overs to lay the foundation for a smooth run chase. After the two openers departed and the wickets fell at the other end, Harsh Thaker (30* off 24 balls) remained unbeaten alongside Mayan Yadav (2* off 3 balls) to see the team home with four balls to spare. For Royals, Scott Kuggeleijn, Saif Zaib and Ishan Pandey claimed a wicket each in a losing cause.

Earlier opting to bat first, Sudurpaschim Royals got off to a great start as openers Saif Zaib (69 off 43 balls) and Binod Bhandari (41 off 31 balls) added 117 runs from 72 balls for the first wicket before Lalit Rajbanshi broke the stand, leading to successive dismissals in the space of 3 deliveries. Destined for a total above 200, Janakpur Bolts struck in regular intervals through Mohammed Mohsin (3 for 40) and Kishor Mahato (3 for 25) to keep the Royals down to 184/9 in their allotted 20 overs. With this, Janakpur Bolts defeated the Sudurpaschim for the first time, having lost to the table-toppers twice earlier in the tournament. The final marked the close of the first edition of the Nepal Premier League (NPL).

subSections.title: Write 'TRUE' for true and 'FALSE' for the false statements.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Janakpur Bolts won the title of the first edition of NPL.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: TRUE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पहिलो वाक्यले भन्छ, "Janakpur Bolts clinched the first ever Nepal Premier League..."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The first sentence says, "Janakpur Bolts clinched the first ever Nepal Premier League..." 
Citation: Lesson 2.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Aasif Sheikh scored individual 87 runs.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले भन्छ, "Lahiru Milantha smashed a 49-ball 87," असिफ शेखले होइन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The text says, "Lahiru Milantha smashed a 49-ball 87," not Aasif Sheikh. 
Citation: Lesson 2.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The three bowlers including Ishan Pandey took a wicket each.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: TRUE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले उल्लेख गर्छ, "Scott Kuggeleijn, Saif Zaib and Ishan Pandey claimed a wicket each..."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The text mentions, "Scott Kuggeleijn, Saif Zaib and Ishan Pandey claimed a wicket each..." 
Citation: Lesson 2.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The run target to Janakpur Bolts was 185.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: TRUE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: सुदूरपश्चिमले १८4/९ रन बनायो, त्यसैले जित्नको लागि लक्ष्य १८५ रन थियो। पाठले "run chase of 185" भन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
Sudurpaschim made 184/9, so the target to win was 185. The text says "run chase of 185." 
Citation: Lesson 2.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Binod Bhandari alone collected 117 runs to first wicket.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले भन्छ, "openers Saif Zaib... and Binod Bhandari... added 117 runs... for the first wicket," अर्थात् दुबै मिलेर, एक्लै होइन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The text says, "openers Saif Zaib... and Binod Bhandari... added 117 runs... for the first wicket," meaning together, not alone. 
Citation: Lesson 2.

subSections.title: Answer the following questions in full sentences.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: When was the news published?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The news was published on December 21.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: समाचारको सुरुमा "By MyKhel Staff, December 21" लेखिएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
At the beginning of the news, it says "By MyKhel Staff, December 21." 
Citation: Lesson 2.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: In which Stadium was the final game of NPL played?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: It was played at the TU International Stadium in Kirtipur.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पहिलो अनुच्छेदमा "at the TU International Stadium in Kirtipur" उल्लेख छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The first paragraph mentions "at the TU International Stadium in Kirtipur." 
Citation: Lesson 2.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Who remained unbeaten together with Mayan Yadav?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Harsh Thaker remained unbeaten alongside Mayan Yadav.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा भनिएको छ, "Harsh Thaker... remained unbeaten alongside Mayan Yadav..."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The text states, "Harsh Thaker... remained unbeaten alongside Mayan Yadav..." 
Citation: Lesson 2.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Which teams played the final of the first edition of NPL?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Janakpur Bolts and Sudurpaschim Royals played the final.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: शीर्षक र पहिलो अनुच्छेदले जनकपुर बोल्ट्स र सुदूरपश्चिम रोयल्स बीचको फाइनल खेलको उल्लेख गर्दछ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The title and first paragraph mention the final between Janakpur Bolts and Sudurpaschim Royals. 
Citation: Lesson 2.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Was the journey of NPL exciting to the Sudurpaschim Royals? Why or why not?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: It was likely exciting but disappointing at the end because they lost the final despite having beaten Janakpur twice before.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: उनीहरूले पहिले दुई पटक जनकपुरलाई हराएका थिए (exciting), तर फाइनलमा हारे (disappointing)।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
They had beaten Janakpur twice before (exciting), but lost in the final (disappointing). 
Citation: Lesson 2.

questions.title: Read the following text and do the tasks.

passage.title: Pushpa Basnet
passage.content:
Pushpa Basnet, born in 1984 in Kathmandu, Nepal, is a Nepali social worker and the founder/president of Early Childhood Development Center (ECDC) and Butterfly Home, non-profit organizations in Kathmandu, Nepal. Her organization works to strengthen the rights of children living behind bars with their incarcerated parents. Her efforts have been recognized by national and international media since she was nominated for CNN Heroes Award which she subsequently won in 2012. She has won the super Hero Award in 2016.

Basnet started her career at the age of 21, while she was still an undergraduate in social work at St. Xavier's College, Kathmandu. As part of her college assignment, she visited the women in prison in Kathmandu. She was dismayed when she saw children with their parents behind the bars. She raised 70,000 rupees from her close friends and sister, and started a non-profit organization - The Early Childhood Development Center (ECDC) to provide a day care program to the children in 2005.

In 2007, she opened a residential home for kids to live outside the prison year around while still visiting their mothers on holidays. Today, she has assisted more than 137 children of incarcerated parents. She runs a day care center for the prison children and a residential home for older ones. She has also helped to provide alternative residence, school enrollment, free meals and medical care to them.

Basnet has been awarded with CNN Hero Award 2012, which was held at the Shrine Auditorium in Los Angeles, California, on Sunday, 2nd December. Academy Award winning actress Susan Sarandon presented Basnet with the award. The show was aired LIVE through CNN.

When earlier interviewed by CNN, she commented on her venture as: "It is not fair for (these) children to live in the prison because they have not done anything wrong ... My mission is to make sure no child grows up behind prison walls."

subSections.title: Choose and copy the correct answer from the given alternatives.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: ECDC and Butterfly Home are __________ organizations.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: non-profit
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पहिलो अनुच्छेदमा तिनीहरूलाई "non-profit organizations" भनेर चिनाइएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The first paragraph identifies them as "non-profit organizations." 
Citation: Lesson 15.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Pushpa Basnet won Super Hero award in __________.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा भनिएको छ, "She has won the super Hero Award in 2016."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The text states, "She has won the super Hero Award in 2016." 
Citation: Lesson 15.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Pushpa Basnet began her __________ at the age of twenty one.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: career
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा उल्लेख छ, "Basnet started her career at the age of 21..."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The text mentions, "Basnet started her career at the age of 21..." 
Citation: Lesson 15.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Pushpa Basnet collected a sum of 70000 rupees from __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: close friends and sister
subQuestions.explanationNepali: उनले "raised 70,000 rupees from her close friends and sister" भनेर उल्लेख गरिएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
It is mentioned that she "raised 70,000 rupees from her close friends and sister." 
Citation: Lesson 15.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Pushpa Basnet has provided __________ to the children in prison.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: alternative residence
subQuestions.explanationNepali: तेस्रो अनुच्छेदमा उनले "provide alternative residence..." भनेर भनिएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
In the third paragraph, it says she helped to "provide alternative residence..." 
Citation: Lesson 15.

subSections.title: Match the meanings in 'Column A' with the correct words from the text in Column 'B'.

A.text: a group of people formed to achieve particular aim
to be chosen for important role
suitable for living in; consisting of house

subSections.explanationNepali: यो मिलान पाठमा प्रयोग भएका शब्दहरूको अर्थमा आधारित छ।
subSections.explanationEnglish:
This matching is based on the meanings of the words as used in the text. 
Citation: Lesson 15.

subSections.title: Answer the following questions in full sentences.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Who is Pushpa Basnet?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Pushpa Basnet is a Nepali social worker and the founder/president of ECDC and Butterfly Home.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पहिलो वाक्यले उनको परिचय दिन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The first sentence introduces her. 
Citation: Lesson 15.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Why did Pushpa Basnet set up a social organization?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: She set it up to help children living behind bars with their incarcerated parents.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: उनले जेलमा रहेका आमाबाबुसँगै बस्ने बालबालिकालाई मद्दत गर्न संस्था स्थापना गरिन्।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
She set it up to help children living behind bars with their incarcerated parents. 
Citation: Lesson 15.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What does ECDC stand for?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: ECDC stands for Early Childhood Development Center.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले ECDC को पूर्ण रूप दिन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The text gives the full form of ECDC. 
Citation: Lesson 15.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Why was Pushpa Basnet given a 'CNN Hero Award'?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: She was given the award for her efforts to strengthen the rights of children living in prison with their parents.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: उनको प्रयास र योगदानको कदर गर्दै उनलाई यो अवार्ड दिइएको हो।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
She was awarded for her efforts and contribution. 
Citation: Lesson 15.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Where was the 'CNN Hero Award' ceremony held?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: It was held at the Shrine Auditorium in Los Angeles, California.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: समारोह लस एन्जलसको श्राइन अडिटोरियममा भएको थियो।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
The ceremony took place at the Shrine Auditorium in Los Angeles. 
Citation: Lesson 15.

questions.title: Study the bar-diagram and interpret it in about 100 words using the clues given below it.

sampleAnswer.title: Interpretation of Bar Diagram: Grade 11 Admission
sampleAnswer.content: The bar diagram illustrates the number of students admitted to Grade 11 at XYZ School over a period of five years, from 2020 to 2024. In 2020, the admission number was the lowest, standing at 150 students. However, the school saw a consistent upward trend in the following years. The number of admitted students increased by exactly 100 each year, reaching 250 in 2021, 350 in 2022, and 450 in 2023. By 2024, the admission reached its peak at 550 students. This gradual and steady progress indicates the growing popularity of XYZ School, likely due to its quality education and improved facilities.
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले बार डायग्रामको व्याख्या गर्दछ। यसले २०२० देखि २०२४ सम्मको भर्ना संख्यामा भएको वृद्धिलाई वर्णन गर्दछ, जहाँ हरेक वर्ष १०० ले वृद्धि भएको छ। यसले विद्यालयको प्रगति र लोकप्रियतालाई संकेत गर्दछ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish:
This answer interprets the bar diagram. It describes the increase in admission numbers from 2020 to 2024, noting a steady rise of 100 students each year. This indicates the school's progress and popularity. 
Citation: Lesson 10.

questions.title: Write a formal message of condolence to be published in a newspaper on behalf of XYZ School using the given outlines.
clues: former speaker of House of Representatives
role in civil rights, peace process, democracy

sampleAnswer.title: HEARTFELT CONDOLENCE
sampleAnswer.content:
We are deeply saddened by the untimely demise of Mr. Daman Nath Dhungana, a senior advocate, human rights activist, and the former Speaker of the House of Representatives, who passed away on 17th November 2024 at Frontline Hospital, Kathmandu, due to liver-related complications. He was 82.

Mr. Dhungana was a towering figure in Nepali politics, known for his pivotal role in the people's movement, the peace process, and the protection of civil rights and democracy. His contribution to the nation as the Speaker from 1991 to 1994 will always be remembered.

We extend our heartfelt condolences to the bereaved family and pray for the eternal peace of the departed soul.

XYZ School Family
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले दमननाथ ढुङ्गानाको निधनमा समवेदना सन्देश प्रस्तुत गर्दछ। यसले उनको मृत्युको विवरण, उनको राजनीतिक र सामाजिक योगदान, र शोकाकुल परिवारप्रति समवेदना व्यक्त गर्दछ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish:
This answer presents a condolence message on the passing of Daman Nath Dhungana. It includes details of his death, his political and social contributions, and expresses sympathy to the bereaved family. 
Citation: Lesson 11.

questions.title: You are Arsey Chaudhary. You want to borrow a book for a week from your school library. Prepare a dialogue in at least six exchanges between you and the librarian in about 150 words.

sampleAnswer.content:
Arsey: Good morning, sir. I would like to borrow a book.

Librarian: Good morning, Arsey. Sure, which book are you looking for?

Arsey: I need 'The Alchemist' by Paulo Coelho. Is it available?

Librarian: Let me check the system. Yes, we have one copy available. Here it is.

Arsey: Thank you, sir. For how many days can I keep it?

Librarian: You can borrow it for one week. You must return it by next Tuesday.

Arsey: Okay, sir. What happens if I am late in returning it?

Librarian: There is a fine of Rs. 5 per day for late returns. So please be on time.

Arsey: I understand. I will return it on time. Here is my library card.

Librarian: Thank you. I have issued the book to your account. Happy reading!
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले विद्यार्थी र लाइब्रेरियन बीचको संवाद प्रस्तुत गर्दछ। विद्यार्थीले किताब माग्छ, लाइब्रेरियनले उपलब्धता जाँच गर्छ, नियमहरू (समयसीमा, जरिवाना) बताउँछ, र किताब जारी गर्छ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish:
This answer presents a dialogue between a student and a librarian. The student asks for a book, the librarian checks availability, explains the rules (deadline, fine), and issues the book. 
Citation: Lesson 5.

questions.title: Write an essay expressing your opinion on the effects of junk food on human health in about 200 words.

sampleAnswer.title: The Harmful Effects of Junk Food
sampleAnswer.content:
In recent years, the consumption of junk food has skyrocketed, becoming a staple in the diet of many, especially the youth. While these foods are tasty and convenient, they pose a significant threat to human health. Junk food is typically defined as food that is high in calories from sugar or fat, with little dietary fiber, protein, vitamins, minerals, or other important forms of nutritional value.

The most immediate effect of consuming junk food is weight gain and obesity. These foods are calorie-dense but nutrient-poor, leading to an excessive intake of energy that the body stores as fat. Obesity opens the door to a host of other chronic diseases, including type 2 diabetes, cardiovascular diseases, and hypertension. The high sodium content in processed foods can raise blood pressure, putting strain on the heart.

Furthermore, junk food can negatively impact mental health. Studies have suggested a link between poor diet and depression or anxiety. The lack of essential nutrients affects brain function and energy levels, leading to fatigue and poor concentration. To maintain a healthy life, it is crucial to limit the intake of junk food and opt for a balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains. Health is wealth, and we must not compromise it for momentary taste.
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले जंक फुडका नकारात्मक प्रभावहरूबारे निबन्ध प्रस्तुत गर्दछ। यसले मोटोपना, मधुमेह, मुटुको रोग जस्ता शारीरिक समस्याहरू र मानसिक स्वास्थ्यमा पर्ने असरहरूलाई समेट्छ। अन्त्यमा, सन्तुलित भोजनको महत्त्वमा जोड दिइएको छ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish:
This answer provides an essay on the negative effects of junk food. It covers physical issues like obesity, diabetes, and heart disease, as well as impacts on mental health. It concludes by emphasizing the importance of a balanced diet. 
Citation: Lesson 6.

questions.title: Reproduce the following sentences as instructed in the brackets.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Anita never gets angry, __________? (Add a correct question tag.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Anita never gets angry, does she?
subQuestions.explanationNepali: 'never' नकारात्मक शब्द हो, त्यसैले ट्याग सकारात्मक हुन्छ। 'gets' (v5) को लागि 'does' प्रयोग गरिन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
'never' is a negative word, so the tag is positive. 'does' is used for 'gets' (v5). 
Citation: Lesson 14.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: By the time I reached home, my father ______ (leave) already home. (Use the correct form of the verb 'leave'.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: By the time I reached home, my father had already left home.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: भूतकालका दुई घटनाहरूमध्ये, पहिले भएको घटना (बुबा निस्केको) को लागि Past Perfect (had left) प्रयोग गरिन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
For the earlier of two past actions (father leaving), the Past Perfect (had left) is used. 
Citation: Lesson 9.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Sunaina came late to school. (Change into negative.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Sunaina did not come late to school.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: Simple Past (came) लाई नकारात्मक बनाउन 'did not' + v1 (come) प्रयोग गरिन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
To make Simple Past (came) negative, 'did not' + v1 (come) is used. 
Citation: Lesson 11.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Krishna visits his grandfather once a month. (Change into 'How often' question.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: How often does Krishna visit his grandfather?
subQuestions.explanationNepali: 'once a month' (frequency) बारे सोध्न 'How often' प्रयोग गरिन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
'How often' is used to ask about frequency ('once a month'). 
Citation: Lesson 18.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The teacher said to the students, "Don't spend your valuable time on mobile." (Change into indirect speech.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The teacher forbade the students to spend their valuable time on mobile. OR The teacher advised the students not to spend their valuable time on mobile.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: Negative imperative लाई 'forbade...to' वा 'advised...not to' प्रयोग गरेर परिवर्तन गरिन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
Negative imperative is changed using 'forbade...to' or 'advised...not to'. 
Citation: Lesson 3.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The culprit was sent to prison by the police. (Change into active voice.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The police sent the culprit to prison.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: Passive 'was sent' (Simple Past) लाई Active मा लैजाँदा 'sent' (v2) हुन्छ। Agent 'The police' विषय बन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish:
Passive 'was sent' (Simple Past) becomes 'sent' (v2) in Active. The agent 'The police' becomes the subject. 
Citation: Lesson 8.

questions.title: Choose and copy the correct answers from the brackets to complete the given text. (Rewriting the text is not compulsory.)
questions.passage: One evening in December I decided to see (a) _____ (a/an/the/no article) my friend, Renuka. Renuka (b) _____ (whose/who/whom/which) everyone called a notorious woman decided to celebrate her 25th birthday. She invited her friends and relatives (c) _____ (to/for/in/of) attend the party. I met her and (d) _____ (wished/to wish/wishing/wishes) her a happy birthday. She was not happy (e) _____ (although/because/in spite of/otherwise) the memorable moment. Suddenly, a lady police officer appeared. She made Renuka (f) _____ (accepts/accepted/accept/accepting) the case of damaging the minister's car because of her reckless driving. She (g) _____ (takes/was being taken/was taken/had taken) to the police station. In the police station, the Deputy Superintendent of police said, "Renuka (h) _____ (May/must/can/will) pay for the harm she has made." If Renuka had driven her motorcycle carefully, she (i) _____ (will not cause/would not cause/would not have caused/would not have been casued) the accident. Finally, she got the (j) _____ (bad/as bad as/worse/worst) penalty.

gaps.explanationNepali: Possessive pronoun 'my' अगाडि article प्रयोग हुँदैन।
gaps.explanationEnglish:
No article is used before the possessive pronoun 'my'. 
Citation: Lesson 7.

gaps.explanationNepali: यहाँ 'Renuka' object को रूपमा छ (everyone called *her*), त्यसैले 'whom' प्रयोग गरिन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish:
Here 'Renuka' functions as an object (everyone called *her*), so 'whom' is used. 
Citation: Lesson 15.

gaps.explanationNepali: उद्देश्य जनाउन infinitive 'to attend' को प्रयोग हुन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish:
The infinitive 'to attend' is used to show purpose. 
Citation: Lesson 18.

'wished' (v2) is used to maintain parallel structure with 'met' (v2). 
Citation: Lesson 9.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'in spite of' पछि noun phrase ('the memorable moment') आउँछ र यसले विरोधाभास देखाउँछ।
gaps.explanationEnglish:
'in spite of' takes a noun phrase and shows contrast. 
Citation: Lesson 13.

gaps.explanationNepali: Causative verb 'make' ले active voice मा bare infinitive (v1) लिन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish:
The causative verb 'make' takes the bare infinitive (v1) in the active voice. 
Citation: Lesson 18.

gaps.explanationNepali: यो passive voice मा छ (उनीलाई लगियो), र भूतकालको घटना हो।
gaps.explanationEnglish:
It is in the passive voice (she was taken), referring to a past event. 
Citation: Lesson 8.

gaps.explanationNepali: यो Type 3 Conditional हो (If + past perfect ... would have + v3)।
gaps.explanationEnglish:
This is a Type 3 Conditional (If + past perfect ... would have + v3). 
Citation: Lesson 5.

gaps.explanationNepali: Superlative degree 'worst' यहाँ सबैभन्दा खराब दण्ड जनाउन प्रयोग गरिन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish:
The superlative 'worst' is used to indicate the most severe penalty. 
Citation: Lesson 10.
